DOC.brief_summary: The excess production colonic short-chain-fatty-acids ( SCFA ) implicate promotion obesity , colonic fermentation dietary-fiber SCFA may also play role prevent diabetes . The investigator aim compare effect two fermentable fiber ( inulin resistant-starch ) postprandial SCFA , glucose , insulin , free-fatty acid ( FFA ) gut hormone response compare responses healthy overweight obese ( OWO ) v lean ( LN ) participant . Methods : Using randomize , single blind , crossover design , 13 OWO 12 LN overnight fast participant study 3 separate occasion . On day consume 300 mL drink contain 75g glucose ( Control ) 75g glucose plus 24g inulin ( IN ) , 28.2g resistant-starch ( RS ) . A standard lunch serve 4 h test drink .
DOC.brief_title: Role Colonic Short Chain Fatty Acids Obesity
DOC.criteria: nonpregnant body mass index > =20 < =35 history diabetes mellitus history cardiovascular disease history bowel disease history kidney disease history liver disease use antibiotic within 3 month enrolment unusual dietary habit fast glucose > 6.9mmol/L hematocrit normal range age sex
